data.name: aiomics
data.description:
Across Europe, healthcare providers lose hours every day to fragmented documentation—handwritten notes, scanned PDFs, dictations, disconnected IT systems. The result: burnout, missed revenue, and patients feeling like they’re asked the same question three times.

Aiomics changes this. Our AI-driven co-pilot captures every clinical detail—speech, handwriting, digital notes—and validates it in real time with a human-in-the-loop process. Interactive checklists surface missing information before the patient leaves, and audit-ready records flow straight back into existing systems. Built for GDPR, MDR, and the EU AI Act from day one, Aiomics makes documentation complete, compliant, and instantly usable.

We don’t replace EHRs—we make them better. From admission and discharge reports to insurer forms, from therapist briefings to patient-friendly letters, Aiomics turns paperwork from a burden into an asset. For providers, that means fewer errors, faster reimbursements, and—most importantly—more time at the bedside.

Our mission: to empower healthcare professionals by removing administrative burdens and elevating their decision-making with trusted AI guidance—so they can reconnect with why they chose this vocation in the first place.

Who we are:
Aiomics is co-founded by Dr. Sven Jungmann, a physician with frontline experience of administrative overload; Dr. Nikita Tarasov, a physicist and data scientist; and a lawyer [to be announced soon] who scaled one of Europe’s largest digitally enabled hospitality companies. Together, we unite empathy, technical mastery, and regulatory expertise to build the trusted co-pilot for Europe’s healthcare providers.

updates.description:
We are, of course, a healthcare company.

But ultimately, our mission is to strengthen resilience — in people, in systems, and in society.

Reducing the burden of messy patient data and documentation for healthcare providers is not just about efficiency or access. It’s about ensuring surge capacity when it’s most needed. It’s about reducing waste. And most importantly, it’s about giving back the energy and purpose that brought most healthcare professionals into patient care in the first place.

At a time when staff shortages are severe and many are leaving the field, this mission feels more urgent than ever. That’s why we don’t just stay in the digital-health bubble. We engage with the broader impact innovation community — to learn from other sectors and connect the missing links of a truly resilient society.

Here’s our founder, Dr. Sven Jungmann, sharing our work with impact founders and funders at Impact Week in Barcelona (Norrsken Barcelona) last week.

Vom Pilotprojekt zur Skalierung – wie wir #Innovation im Gesundheitswesen endlich groß machen.
Viele #KI-Projekte im Gesundheitswesen bleiben Pilotprojekte – die Wirkung verpufft.
Doch: Skalierung ist der Schlüssel, wenn wir echte #Transformation wollen.
Im Panel diskutieren: 
Nicolas Weber (Healthcare Entrepreneur & Investor)
Dr. Sven Jungmann (aiomics) und
Dr. Tobias Daniel Gantner (HealthCare Futurists GmbH).
📍 DGKIMED-Summit | 03.11.2025 | Potsdam
❓Welche Hürde bremst aus Ihrer Sicht die Skalierung am meisten – Finanzierung, Akzeptanz oder Regulierung?

 ➡️ Jetzt anmelden: https://lnkd.in/dB6umXpy 
Nicolas Weber Jens Schneider Thomas Moesta Prof. Dr. Stefan Heinemann Alexandra Jürgens Dr. Robert Jacob Siming Bayer Dr. Ilias Tsimpoulis

The new Gestalt Podcast episode is out.

With our guest, Dr. Sven Jungmann — a medical doctor turned entrepreneur — we unveil cases and tools that work. Disqualify what does not.

We'd be curious to know what are you doing with AI at work? Drop your case, tools, agents 🤙

--
The podcast is available on Apple, Spotify, and YouTube. Find a link to your favorite platform in the sticky comment.

It's about psychology, philosophy, learnings and failures of 2 successful digital creators.

We’re proud that our CEO, Dr. Sven Jungmann, contributed to human Magazin’s special issue “human Forward – Smart Resilience: Defending Europe.” [in German]

The interview touches on challenges that resonate far beyond hospitals:
Healthcare’s core bottleneck is staff shortages. According to World Health Organization, #Europe will be missing 4+ millions of professionals by 2030. This isn’t just an economic issue—it threatens care quality and access.
Documentation is a silent drain. Doctors and nurses spend hours every day on paperwork instead of patients. Reducing this burden is one of the fastest ways to strengthen resilience in healthcare.

The physician–patient relationship is shifting. With tools like #ChatGPT, patients come better informed and more proactive. That creates both pressure and opportunity for clinicians—opening the door for more dialogue on equal footing.

We truly value human Magazin’s mission to explore resilience and democracy with a human-centred lens. Conversations like these remind us that technology alone isn’t enough: it has to serve people, values, and society.

👉 The full publication is available here: https://lnkd.in/e84XJwxa 

#healthcare #resilience #AI #humanintheloop #digitalhealth
Get an impression how our CEO thinks about innovation.

updates.description:
🚑 Warum scheitern digitale Innovationen im Krankenhaus?

Ob KI-gestützte Dokumentation, Telemonitoring oder Robotik – es fehlt nicht an Technologien im Gesundheitswesen. Aber warum bleiben so viele Innovationen im Pilotprojekt stecken und schaffen es nicht in die klinische Routine?
Darüber hat unser Dr. Sven Jungmann mit Prof. Akira Poncette, Anästhesiologe, Medizininformatiker und Professor für Clinical Implementation Science an der Charité - Universitätsmedizin Berlin, gesprochen.

Sie diskutieren u. a.:
 🔹 Warum Technologien oft nicht an der Idee, sondern am Kontext scheitern
 🔹 Welche Rolle Implementierungswissenschaft spielt und welche Frameworks Kliniken wirklich weiterhelfen
 🔹 Wie schon drei Workshops den Unterschied machen können
 🔹 Warum das lernende Krankenhaus die einzig realistische Vision für die Zukunft ist

Wir freuen uns auf eure Gedanken: Wie schafft ihr es, digitale Projekte nachhaltig in den Klinikalltag zu bringen?

#DigitalHealth #Krankenhausmanagement #Innovation #Implementierungswissenschaft

🚑 Warum scheitern so viele digitale Projekte in Krankenhäusern – obwohl die Technologie eigentlich funktioniert?

In unserer neuen Aiomics-Serie spricht unser Dr. Sven Jungmann mit Prof. Akira Poncette (Charité Berlin) über ein Thema, das bisher viel zu wenig Beachtung findet: Implementierungswissenschaft.

👉 Was Sie in der Folge erfahren:
- Warum es nicht reicht, „nur“ ein gutes Tool zu haben.
- Welche Rolle Kontext, Strategie und Partizipation für den Erfolg spielen.
- Wie Krankenhausleitungen mit klaren Frameworks (CFIR, ERIC) aus dem Trial & Error herauskommen.
- Praktische Ansätze: drei kurze Workshops, Champions im Team, hybride Studien.
- Was ein „lernendes Krankenhaus“ ausmacht – und warum das die Zukunft ist.

🎥 Das Gespräch richtet sich an Krankenhausleitungen, Ärztliche Direktor:innen, IT-Verantwortliche und alle, die Innovation wirklich in die Praxis bringen wollen.

➡️ https://lnkd.in/eZuk9T46

Fazit: Technologie allein reicht nicht. Wer wissen will, wie digitale Projekte wirklich erfolgreich werden, sollte dieses Interview nicht verpassen.

"Berlin’s Aiomics Raises €2M to Tackle Europe’s Healthcare Documentation Burden."

Berlin based HealthTech startup aiomics has raised €2 million in pre-seed funding to scale its AI-powered documentation platform across diverse care settings and prepare for expansion into new European markets.

The round was led by Vorwerk Ventures, with participation from Calm/Storm, Norrsken Evolve, rule30, and notable business angels such as Konstantin Othmer, Nicolas Weber, Andrea Kranzer, and Markus Wild. Investors see Aiomics as part of a larger shift in clinical software, where AI-driven solutions are unbundling traditional systems to deliver more flexible, context aware tools.

Founded in 2025 by Dr. Sven Jungmann, Dr. Nikita Tarasov, and Kirill Schitomirski, Aiomics is on a mission to reduce administrative overhead for clinicians, nurses, and therapists. Its platform captures speech, handwriting, and documents in one validated workflow, checks for completeness and consistency, and feeds structured, audit secure data back into hospital systems.

By minimizing documentation errors, accelerating reimbursements, and freeing up time for patient care, Aiomics is tackling one of Europe’s most persistent healthcare challenges: the administrative burden draining medical staff resources. With fresh funding, the company plans to extend its platform into hospitals, rehabilitation centers, and telemedicine providers while entering additional European markets.

As Europe grapples with workforce shortages and rising demand for care, Aiomics’ promise is simple but powerful: let doctors treat patients, not paperwork.

#HealthTech #DigitalHealth #AIinHealthcare #HealthcareInnovation #PreSeedFunding #Startups #ImpactTech #HealthcareTransformation #EuropeanTech #Aiomics #cxolanes

🇩🇪 Berlin-based aiomics, a HealthTech company tackling Europe’s medical documentation burden, has secured €2 million in a pre-Seed round led by Vorwerk Ventures, with participation from Calm/Storm, Norrsken Evolve, rule30 and notable business angels including Konstantin Othmer, Nicolas Weber, Andrea Kranzer and Markus Wild.

Founded in 2025 by Dr. Sven Jungmann, Dr Nikita Tarasov and Kirill Schitomirski, Aiomics develops an AI-powered documentation platform designed to ease the workload of doctors, nurses, and therapists. 

By capturing speech, handwriting, and documents in one validated workflow and returning structured, coded, and audit-secure data, Aiomics reduces errors, accelerates reimbursements, and frees clinicians to spend more time on patient care.

With this fresh capital, the company will expand its platform, scale across acute hospitals, rehabilitation centers and telemedicine providers, and prepare entry into new European markets, pushing forward its mission of relieving healthcare systems from administrative overload and empowering medical staff.

And congratulations on already closing your fabulous €2M pre‑seed round, with backing from Vorwerk Ventures and Calm/Storm. 

Welcome to Stockholm, aiomics!

It's official now—we’ve raised a €2M pre‑seed to build a healthcare co‑pilot that gives healthcare workers the time, guidance, and insight to return to their calling. Our goal is not just to cut admin—it’s to turn fragmented inputs into reliable, coded, audit‑ready data that supports better decisions across care and operations. We're not another scribe company, we're orchestrating data along the care journey beyond speech-to-text.

We’re now shipping a hospital‑grade data‑quality layer that captures documents (printed and digital), handwriting, and speech in one validated workflow (with human‑in‑the‑loop), flags gaps in real time, and feeds structured outputs back into existing systems and deploys AI assistants to take away most of the annoying documentation work that none of our users ever wanted to do in the first place.

We’re proud to be backed by institutional investors who truly understand healthcare and impact: Vorwerk Ventures, Calm/Storm, Norrsken Evolve, and rule30. 

After years as an operator, funder, and advisor in this field, our founder and CEO Dr. Sven Jungmann learned to value professional investors who actually understand healthcare and impact. There are too many trend surfers trying to import playbooks from unrelated industries. The teams behind our VCs are different—thoughtful, domain‑literate, and constructive. We can only recommend them to other health‑tech founders.

Deep thanks also to our angels: Konstantin Othmer, Nicolas Weber, Markus Wild, Christian Macht, Eddy Moosavi Pour, Steffen P Walz, and Bertram Duerr (and two more who prefer not to be named). You came in when things were still uncertain. This means the world and makes a huge difference.

We have big plans for Europe—more on what we’re rolling out next very soon.
 Handelsblatt covered the story today; link in the first comment.

#healthtech #AI #hospitals #medtech #compliance #Europe #startups #Aiomics
We are glad to announce that our new webpage is online. Looking forward to your feedback. www.aiomics.io 😊

We’re hiring: Senior Application Security Engineer (Next.js & Cloud‑Native HealthTech)

At aiomics, we build the cloud‑and‑AI layer hospitals actually adopt—secure, private, and intuitive so clinicians can focus on care. Security isn’t a gate here; it’s a core product capability and a durable edge we plan to keep.

Mission
Lead Aiomics to stay ahead on application security. Build the practices, guardrails, and culture so that trust is the default—before patient data ever touches our systems.

What you’ll do (high‑leverage work)
- Establish the application security function end‑to‑end for a Next.js platform (Server Actions, API routes).
- Threat‑model critical user journeys (patient data access, practitioner authentication) and turn insights into a living roadmap.
- Integrate SAST/SCA into CI/CD for fast, useful feedback; tune for signal over noise.
- Partner with our cloud team to harden AWS/Vercel/Clerk and reduce high‑severity findings.
- Publish clear, pragmatic secure‑coding guidelines and lightweight docs the team will actually use.
- Run a respectful, well‑structured responsible disclosure program and be a great counterpart to researchers.

What we expect
- You’ve found and fixed critical web vulns (OWASP Top 10) in modern JS apps—ideally Next.js.
- You understand authN/authZ in practice (JWTs, sessions, middleware) and how to keep them robust.
- You’re comfortable with AWS security tooling (Security Hub, GuardDuty, IAM Access Analyzer).
- You communicate risk clearly, make trade‑offs explicit, and keep momentum.

How we work
- Tight iteration loops, whole‑journey reviews, and shipping small slices to validate assumptions early. We build to a medical‑device standard of quality (traceability, risk thinking, HIPAA/GDPR) from day one.
Setup
- Full‑time employment in Germany (required), we do not sponsor working permits.
- Berlin or remote (EU time zones); occasional site visits optional.

If this is your kind of challenge, let’s talk (contact CEO Dr. Sven Jungmann).

We’re thrilled to welcome Kirill Schitomirski as our founding COO & CLO at aiomics. 

Kirill brings more than a decade of legal practice and first-hand scaling experience from Numa group, where he helped grow from 1 hotel in #Berlin to more than 200 properties and over 10,000 units across 16 countries. 

At aiomics, he’ll focus on creating smooth operations and embedding compliance into everything we do. Healthcare often looks to aviation and gastronomy for lessons in safety and quality. We believe it can also learn from hospitality—where operational excellence and customer experience go hand in hand.

Welcome on board, Kirill! Glad to have you on board!

Norrsken Accelerator → Norrsken Evolve!

Europe stands at a defining moment. In the face of unprecedented risks, our economies, industries, and ways of living, must evolve.

Today we are proud to announce the close of Norrsken Evolve, a new €57m fund to back the founders building Europe’s future, and an evolution of Norrsken Accelerator. 

Spearheaded by partners Rebecka Löthman Rydå, Johan Attby and Alex Bakir, Norrsken Evolve invests in European founders and visionaries who will redefine how we generate energy, rebuild manufacturing, move goods, construct buildings, produce food & materials, treat our sick, secure our information and safeguard our societies from climate disruption. 

* €250k up-front investment
* World-class in-person sprint
* Top-tier advisory network

The oversubscribed close of the €57m Evolve fund was made possible with the support of institutional investors Saminvest AB, the European Investment Fund (EIF), and SmartCap Green Fund, funded by the European Union NextGenerationEU; as well as leading tech-founders and family offices.

Learn more via link in comments.

I'm proud to announce that aiomics is now backed by Norrsken Evolve, a pre-seed fund that invests in entrepreneurs building Europe's sustainable and resilient future. As part of this we've travelled to Sweden for a sprint, happening at the beautiful Norrsken House in my beloved Stockholm. 

It takes a village to build a company. Thanks for the warm welcome Alex Bakir, Rebecka Löthman Rydå, Johan Attby, Inez Atmer, Ebba Forsberg, Sjoerd Stevens & Edvin Eriksson! You have done a brilliant job at bringing a fantastic group of entrepreneurs together and to create the psychological safety and environment for us to learn and grow together as we are building our ventures.

🚨 We’re hiring a UX/UI Designer @ Aiomics

📍 Remote-first (Germany/EU) | 💼 Work permit for Germany required (German tax residency necessary) | 🗣 Fluent German & English, ideally one more European language

If you could design something that gave doctors hours back every day — would you?

Every day in Europe, highly skilled clinicians spend almost as much time typing as treating. Nurses fill in the same information twice. Patients are asked the same question three times. Critical details get buried in PDFs. Meanwhile, staff shortages are at crisis levels, and burnout is driving talent out of healthcare.

We’re here to change that.

At Aiomics, we capture and structure every important detail — from speech, handwriting, scans, or digital forms — so it’s validated, coded, and ready to use in real time. We then deploy customisable AI assistants to take care of most soul draining tasks done manually by healthcare workers today. That means more time for care, fewer errors, faster reimbursements, and a safer, more human-centered healthcare system.

You’d join a highly capable, low-ego team:
🩺 A doctor with 10+ years in digital health and frontline clinical work
🧮 A physicist/data scientist with deep AI experience
⚖️ A lawyer who scaled a major tech company across Europe
🚀 A product manager who worked for some of the best known health tech companies
💻 A top-notch software team with serious healthcare domain expertise

We’re backed by leading healthcare & impact investors and work with some of Europe’s most respected hospitals and research partners.

We’re looking for someone who can:
– Turn deep, multilingual UX research into designs that work in real clinics with real constraints
– Move seamlessly between qualitative insights and quantitative validation — designing experiments, not just interfaces
– Anticipate the regulatory and reimbursement realities that shape healthcare products
– Craft AI-first, multimodal interactions (voice, handwriting, text, sensors) that feel natural and safe for users
– Help us deliver on our early product promises fast, without compromising quality or trust

In your first 6–12 months, you might:
– Create the machine–human interaction blueprint that will define how our AI platform feels for years to come
– Work directly with clinicians, nurses, therapists, and patients to design workflows that instantly save time and reduce burnout
– Shape prototypes that make investors lean in — and make frontline staff say “Finally, someone truly understands me”
– Prove that great design can thrive even under the strictest compliance rules

This isn’t for everyone. Healthcare is complex, slow to change, and deeply regulated. But if you thrive where stakes are high, details matter, and the impact is real — you’ll probably do the most meaningful work of your career here.

Let’s fix the way healthcare works, one interaction at a time.

#hiring #ux #ui #designforimpact #digitalhealth #AI #multimodal #healthtech #aiomics #startupjobs

𝐃𝐢𝐞 𝐙𝐮𝐤𝐮𝐧𝐟𝐭 𝐢𝐬𝐭 𝐠𝐞𝐧𝐚𝐮 𝐣𝐞𝐭𝐳𝐭.

Der #SummerSummit2025 war mein persönliches Highlight: Über 100 Patient:innenvertreter:innen bei Roche, vereint durch ein Ziel #NothingForPatientsWithoutPatients.

Unter dem Motto „Mit deiner Stimme Zukunft gestalten“ sprachen wir offen über frühe Patient:innenbeteiligung in Studien und mein Herzensthema: KI im Shared Decision Making.

Besonders bewegend: Dr. Alexandra Widmer berichtete, wie eine Patientin sie fragte: „Meine KI hat mir ein Medikament empfohlen - verschreiben Sie es mir?“ Ein Moment, der zeigt: Der Wandel ist längst da.

Gemeinsam mit Inga Bergen, Dr. Sven Jungmann und Nele von Horsten sprachen wir über das Whitepaper „Mit KI zur gemeinsamen Entscheidungsfindung in der Medizin“ - es bündelt konkrete KI-Anwendungsbeispiele, Prompts und Perspektiven aus Medizin, Tech, Ethik und Recht. Im Zentrum steht die Frage: Wie schaffen wir eine verantwortungsvolle, zugängliche Nutzung von KI im Gesundheitswesen?

Fazit: „Es ist ein Kunstfehler, heute keine KI einzusetzen.“ Oder wie Dario Madani sagte: „KI geht in den Dialog. Sie macht Wissen zugänglich.“ 

💙Danke an Sarah Kuld & das gesamte Team für zwei Tage voller Haltung, Austausch und echter Begegnung - und an Jule Koger und Lukas Groß für die fantastische Zusammenarbeit!

#KI4patients #SummerSummit

🚨 We’re hiring a Full Stack Developer (frontend-leaning) @ aiomics
📍 Remote-first (Germany/EU) | 💼 Work permit for Germany required

Help us build the AI infrastructure Europe’s healthcare system urgently needs.

At aiomics, we’re turning the tide on staff shortages and documentation overload by co-developing with clinicians, building AI tools that actually save time — not create more work. Our platform transforms messy medical data into structured, actionable documentation, improving care and freeing up capacity.

You’d join a highly capable, low-ego team:
🧠 A doctor with 10+ years in digital health (me)
📊 A physicist/data scientist with deep AI experience
⚖️ A lawyer who scaled a major tech company
💻 A top-notch software team with serious healthcare domain expertise

We’re backed by well-connected investors and preparing for large-scale implementations with leading hospitals.

You should bring:
– Solid full stack experience with strong frontend capabilities
– Familiarity with cloud infra (AWS preferred)
– Curiosity, pragmatism, and high code quality standards
– Comfort working in fast-moving, cross-functional teams
– Prior health tech experience is a bonus, not a must

This is not a feature factory. This is AI done right, in service of real people. If that excites you, let’s talk.

📩 DM me

#hiring #fullstackdeveloper #frontend #AI #digitalhealth #aiomics #impactdriven #healthtech #startupjobs 🙋♂️

aiomics wächst — wer kann Talente empfehlen? Wir suchen Head of Product, UX/UI Designer, Clinical Manager, ML Engineer (AWS und/oder NLP Fokus). Vorzugsweise Standort Berlin, aber grundsätzlich flexibel. Muss fließend Deutsch sprechen. Klinik oder medizinische Erfahrung von großem Vorteil. Wir starten mit guter Finanzierung und mehreren größeren Klinikpartnern, wie auch innovativen digitalen Gesundheitsanbietern. Es gibt jede Menge zu tun, und wir haben eine wirklich spannende Wachstumskurve vor uns. Das Team besteht ausnahmslos aus sehr seniorigen Experten mit ganz unterschiedlichen Hintergründen. Von Medizin über Datenwissenschaften, Rechtswissenschaften und Co.

I've been giving a lot of talks to people working at the front lines of healthcare, and I'm clearly seeing a massive change in their perception of digitalization and artificial intelligence. 

Even in the most recent months or perhaps over the past year, it has become very clear to me that healthcare providers understand how fundamentally different the current AI era is from previous software, and there is a huge willingness to adopt new technologies, experiment, test, and contribute to their refinement 

Here is another really well-written article in German about the shared decision making white paper that I recently co-authored with different experts and representatives from Roche's Independent Patient Council.

https://lnkd.in/evvD5A5p

Artificial intelligence is fundamentally changing how patients and clinicians work together to solve health problems in a much more personalized way than what we used to see even just a few years ago. This was a great topic our CEO Dr. Sven Jungmann discussed with a group of patient experts recently in Grenzach-Wyhlen , the beautiful German headquarter of Roche. 

More on this (in German for now, English coming soon) here: https://lnkd.in/eEw_YhDK

Es ist wieder Zeit für neue Startups! Hier einige ganz junge Startups, die jeder kennen sollte. Heute stellen wir diese Jungunternehmen vor: aiomics, ArInLaS, bryo, Omnisent und ChangePath.

https://lnkd.in/dE35RT29

🏥 ML Engineer Opportunity: Build AI Infrastructure for European Healthcare 🏥

We're looking for an ML Engineer based in Germany to join our international team at aiomics. If you know someone great—or if this sounds like you—please reach out directly. 🙋♂️ 

What we're building: We're currently implementing our AI platform across 7 hospital facilities with advanced medical services. Our product is designed to save medical teams hours daily on documentation, using that time for meaningful patient care instead while having much better information on their patients. Our early hospital partners alone could reach 5M patients annually—and we are only getting started. There have several more implementations in preparation right now.

What we're working on: 
• Building ML systems that process unstructured medical data in various languages—from handwritten notes to discharge letters to lab reports 
• Developing intelligent document extraction and structuring with ICD-10/SNOMED CT coding 
• Creating AI assistants that help draft all sorts of medical documentation, patient education material, and insurance and compliance forms 
• Designing for real-world healthcare: multilingual processing (24+ languages), GDPR/MDR compliance built in 
• Working on challenging NLP problems specific to European medical language patterns

You'll work directly with our CTO Nikita Tarasov on core infrastructure decisions and implement the latest ML technologies in a compliant manner. No competing projects—just one product, built right.

Our team: 5 core members from different countries, speaking 9 languages collectively. I'm a doctor-turned-founder, bringing healthcare expertise to technical decisions. We reason from first principles, move fast, remove roadblocks efficiently, and build solid foundations—no shortcuts on quality.

Requirements: 
• Work authorization in Germany 
• Drive to transform healthcare through technology
• German language skills valuable (other European languages also great) 

We prefer warm introductions—no recruiters please. Join us in giving healthcare professionals their time back and enabling them to do what made them choose this profession in the first place: being there for their patients.

#MachineLearning #HealthTech #MLJobs #GermanyJobs #AIEngineering

Es ist wieder Zeit für neue Startups! Hier einige ganz junge Startups, die jeder kennen sollte. Heute stellen wir diese Jungunternehmen vor: aiomics, ArInLaS, bryo, Omnisent und ChangePath.

https://lnkd.in/dE35RT29

Introducing our new digital home at aiomics

Today, we're pleased to share our completely reimagined website at www.aiomics.io — a reflection of how we're approaching healthcare's documentation challenge with fresh perspective and proven technology.

When Nikita Tarasov and I started aiomics, we set out to solve a problem every healthcare professional knows intimately: the hours lost to managing unstructured documents, the frustration of incomplete patient information, and the revenue left on the table due to documentation gaps. 

Our new site showcases how we're turning these challenges into opportunities for better care.

What you'll find:
• A clear articulation of our triple value proposition: improving patient care through better data quality, returning hours to clinical teams, and capturing revenue through accurate documentation 
• Coming soon: Detailed product pages for Symphony (our data orchestration platform) and Chorus (our AI assistant suite) that explain exactly how we transform documentation workflows 
• Coming soon: Information on our commitment to keeping humans at the center of healthcare, with AI as an amplifier of clinical expertise rather than a replacement

We've intentionally designed this site to reflect our values: no buzzwords, no unfounded promises, just practical solutions backed by research. Because healthcare professionals deserve honest partners who understand that behind every document is a patient waiting for care.

For our early partners and other forward-thinking organizations already working with us: thank you for trusting us to be part of your digital transformation journey. Your insights have shaped not just our technology, but how we communicate our mission.

We invite you to explore the new site and share your thoughts. Whether you're wrestling with documentation challenges in your own organization or simply interested in how AI can meaningfully improve healthcare operations, we'd love to hear from you.

Visit us at www.aiomics.io and let's continue the conversation about building better healthcare infrastructure for Europe.

#HealthcareInnovation #DigitalHealth #MedTech #HealthIT #AIinHealthcare

Wie kann Künstliche Intelligenz die gemeinsame Entscheidungsfindung zwischen Ärzt:innen und Patient:innen unterstützen?  

Anlässlich des bundesweiten Digitaltages 2025 stellt ein Teil des 12-köpfigen Autorenteams das White Paper “Mit KI zur gemeinsamen ­Entscheidungsfindung in der Medizin” vor. Der praktische Wegweiser zeigt an Beispielen, wie Künstliche Intelligenz ein “Shared Decision Making” zwischen Ärzt:innen und Patient:innen unterstützen kann.

💡Lead Autor und Arzt Dr. Sven Jungmann, Patientin Nele von Horsten und Anja Thelen von Roche als Projektleitung zeigen an Beispielen die Nutzung des Wegweisers. Die Moderation übernimmt Dr. Cornelius Wittal. Eine rege Diskussion ist erwünscht. Die Veranstaltung richtet sich an Patient:innen, Angehörige und Ärzt:innen. 

🗓️Veranstaltungstag: 26.06.2025, von 12:00 Uhr bis 12:45 Uhr. Virtuelle Veranstaltung.

👉Zur Registrierung bitte via Online-Formular unter https://lnkd.in/e4XFA6Zp (Website cvent.com). Eine Bestätigung wird per E-Mail versandt (Absender der Bestätigungs-E-Mail ist grenzach.events at roche.com).

Die Übertragung findet virtuell mit ZOOM statt. Nur die Referent:innen und der Moderator werden mit einem Videobild übertragen. Fragen werden per Chatfunktion (F/A) mit dem Webconferencing-Tool Zoom gestellt.

Two startup reality checks from our journey:
First: Everyone talks about building solutions with end users, but in healthcare, getting genuine access to clinical teams who can dedicate time to co-creation is incredibly challenging.

Second: German hospitals have a reputation for being slow to adopt new technologies. Just a few months ago, we couldn't have imagined we'd be spending most of our time building directly with hospital teams.

But something has shifted. Healthcare organizations are now actively seeking innovation partners, and MEDICLIN under Dr. Christian Dohmen-Griesenbach's leadership is pioneering this change.

What makes this partnership remarkable is the depth of collaboration. Linda Pistor, Dr. Dimitrios Artemis, Prof. Dr. Philipp Hüllemann, Dr. Max Holger Warnke, Dr. Florian Weber, and their colleagues aren't just stakeholders providing occasional feedback. They're opening up their workflows, sharing their daily  challenges with documentation, and actively shaping how our infrastructure evolves.

We're learning from the field what rehabilitation physicians need during admissions, how nurses navigate between systems, what information therapists actually need for treatment planning, and what legally mandated compliance tasks are keeping staff away from meaningful patient interactions. This isn't theoretical user research – it's building alongside the people who know exactly where technology can make the biggest difference.

The readiness for change we're witnessing at MEDICLIN signals something bigger: German healthcare is ready to pick up significant pace in digital transformation.

More insights from this collaboration coming soon.

#StartupLessons #HealthTech #GermanHealthcare #DigitalTransformation

updates.reshared_post_description:
💡 Pfingsten, Heiliger Geist und die digitale Erleuchtung im Gesundheitswesen

Pfingsten steht traditionell für Inspiration, Aufbruch – und den „Heiligen Geist“ als Impulsgeber für Verständigung und Veränderung. Ein passender Anlass, um über strukturelle Erneuerung im Gesundheitswesen nachzudenken.

🧠 Der aktuelle Interview-Beitrag mit dem Arzt und KI-Experten Dr. Sven Jungmann im FOCUS zur Rolle von KI in der Medizin bringt zentrale Gedanken auf den Punkt:

• KI ist kein Ersatz, sondern ein Werkzeug, um ärztliches Denken zu erweitern.
• Der Einstieg gelingt über pragmatische Automatisierungen – etwa in der Dokumentation und Prozessstruktur.
• Die Grundlage bleibt: saubere, vielfältige und vernetzte Daten.

https://lnkd.in/ehksfPtC

🛠️ Genau hier setzen wir auch bei #MEDICLIN gemeinsam mit Sven in einem zentralen Projekt an. Dort befassen wir uns mit der automatisierten Strukturierung großer Mengen klinischer Informationen – aus Vorsystemen, von Papier und aus unstrukturierten Formaten. Ziel ist es, diese Daten für eine intelligente Weiterverarbeitung verfügbar zu machen: schneller, nachvollziehbarer, nutzbar für Patientenversorgung und Entscheidungsunterstützung und Entlastung. Und natürlich folgt dieses Projekt einer Gesamtstrategie.

🤝 Besonders wichtig:
Dieses Projekt entsteht nicht top-down, sondern wird aus der klinischen Praxis heraus gestaltet – gemeinsam mit Ärzten, Therapeuten, Pflegekräften, Qualitätsmanagern und Kaufleuten. Die digitale Transformation wird dadurch konkreter, anschlussfähiger und nachhaltiger. Deshalb ein großer Dank an Linda Pistor, Dr. Dimitrios Artemis, Prof. Dr. Philipp Hüllemann, Dr. Max Holger Warnke, Dr. Florian Weber u.v.m. über den Blick hinter die Kulissen der Reha von heute. Wer sich noch am Projekt beteiligen möchte, kann sich gerne bei mir melden!

🌬️ Pfingsten als Fest der Verständigung erinnert uns daran, dass Fortschritt dort gelingt, wo wir Komplexität in Struktur überführen – mit digitalen Mitteln, aber im Dienst eines menschlichen Gesundheitswesens.

#DigitaleGesundheit #KIinderReha #BottomUpInnovation #Pfingsten2025

updates.description:
Milestone Achievement: Aiomics® Recognized by BAFA INVEST Zuschuss Program
We're pleased to share that we have been approved for the BAFA INVEST Zuschuss program by the German Federal Office for Economic Affairs and Export Control (BAFA). This recognition formally classifies us as a "young innovative company" within the German startup ecosystem.

What is the BAFA INVEST Zuschuss?
For those unfamiliar with this program, it represents a strategic initiative by the German government to stimulate investment in innovative early-stage companies. The program functions as a de facto government endorsement of a startup's innovation potential and business model viability.

The Significance Beyond Financial Benefits
This approval process involves an independent evaluation of our company conducted by federal authorities.

This designation carries three key implications:

1. External Validation: It provides independent verification of our innovation claims and business model from government experts who evaluate hundreds of companies annually.
2. Risk Mitigation for Investors: The program offers private investors a 15% reimbursement on their investment and a 25% reimbursement on their exit sum, effectively improving the risk-return profile of investing in our company.
3. Ecosystem Recognition: It positions us within Germany's formal innovation framework, potentially opening doors to additional innovation-focused resources, partnerships, and networks.

We see this milestone not merely as a financial incentive mechanism, but as validation of our team's hard work and our strategic direction. And we're pleased to be able to sweeten the deal for our ever so supportive investors, many of which have been an integral part of Dr. Sven Jungmann's previous journey(s). 

We're grateful for this recognition and look forward to delivering on the innovative potential that this designation acknowledges.

#Innovation #StartupGrowth #GermanTech #BAFA #aiomics

Artificial intelligence is fundamentally changing how patients and clinicians work together to solve health problems in a much more personalized way than what we used to see even just a few years ago. This was a great topic our CEO Dr. Sven Jungmann discussed with a group of patient experts recently in Grenzach-Wyhlen , the beautiful German headquarter of Roche. 

More on this (in German for now, English coming soon) here: https://lnkd.in/eEw_YhDK

Es ist wieder Zeit für neue Startups! Hier einige ganz junge Startups, die jeder kennen sollte. Heute stellen wir diese Jungunternehmen vor: aiomics, ArInLaS, bryo, Omnisent und ChangePath.

https://lnkd.in/dE35RT29

Introducing our new digital home at aiomics

Today, we're pleased to share our completely reimagined website at www.aiomics.io — a reflection of how we're approaching healthcare's documentation challenge with fresh perspective and proven technology.

When Nikita Tarasov and I started aiomics, we set out to solve a problem every healthcare professional knows intimately: the hours lost to managing unstructured documents, the frustration of incomplete patient information, and the revenue left on the table due to documentation gaps. 

Our new site showcases how we're turning these challenges into opportunities for better care.

What you'll find:
• A clear articulation of our triple value proposition: improving patient care through better data quality, returning hours to clinical teams, and capturing revenue through accurate documentation 
• Coming soon: Detailed product pages for Symphony (our data orchestration platform) and Chorus (our AI assistant suite) that explain exactly how we transform documentation workflows 
• Coming soon: Information on our commitment to keeping humans at the center of healthcare, with AI as an amplifier of clinical expertise rather than a replacement

We've intentionally designed this site to reflect our values: no buzzwords, no unfounded promises, just practical solutions backed by research. Because healthcare professionals deserve honest partners who understand that behind every document is a patient waiting for care.

For our early partners and other forward-thinking organizations already working with us: thank you for trusting us to be part of your digital transformation journey. Your insights have shaped not just our technology, but how we communicate our mission.

We invite you to explore the new site and share your thoughts. Whether you're wrestling with documentation challenges in your own organization or simply interested in how AI can meaningfully improve healthcare operations, we'd love to hear from you.

Visit us at www.aiomics.io and let's continue the conversation about building better healthcare infrastructure for Europe.

#HealthcareInnovation #DigitalHealth #MedTech #HealthIT #AIinHealthcare

Wie kann Künstliche Intelligenz die gemeinsame Entscheidungsfindung zwischen Ärzt:innen und Patient:innen unterstützen?  

Anlässlich des bundesweiten Digitaltages 2025 stellt ein Teil des 12-köpfigen Autorenteams das White Paper “Mit KI zur gemeinsamen ­Entscheidungsfindung in der Medizin” vor. Der praktische Wegweiser zeigt an Beispielen, wie Künstliche Intelligenz ein “Shared Decision Making” zwischen Ärzt:innen und Patient:innen unterstützen kann.

💡Lead Autor und Arzt Dr. Sven Jungmann, Patientin Nele von Horsten und Anja Thelen von Roche als Projektleitung zeigen an Beispielen die Nutzung des Wegweisers. Die Moderation übernimmt Dr. Cornelius Wittal. Eine rege Diskussion ist erwünscht. Die Veranstaltung richtet sich an Patient:innen, Angehörige und Ärzt:innen. 

🗓️Veranstaltungstag: 26.06.2025, von 12:00 Uhr bis 12:45 Uhr. Virtuelle Veranstaltung.

👉Zur Registrierung bitte via Online-Formular unter https://lnkd.in/e4XFA6Zp (Website cvent.com). Eine Bestätigung wird per E-Mail versandt (Absender der Bestätigungs-E-Mail ist grenzach.events at roche.com).

Die Übertragung findet virtuell mit ZOOM statt. Nur die Referent:innen und der Moderator werden mit einem Videobild übertragen. Fragen werden per Chatfunktion (F/A) mit dem Webconferencing-Tool Zoom gestellt.

🏥 ML Engineer Opportunity: Build AI Infrastructure for European Healthcare 🏥

We're looking for an ML Engineer based in Germany to join our international team at aiomics. If you know someone great—or if this sounds like you—please reach out directly. 🙋♂️ 

What we're building: We're currently implementing our AI platform across 7 hospital facilities with advanced medical services. Our product is designed to save medical teams hours daily on documentation, using that time for meaningful patient care instead while having much better information on their patients. Our early hospital partners alone could reach 5M patients annually—and we are only getting started. There have several more implementations in preparation right now.

What we're working on: 
• Building ML systems that process unstructured medical data in various languages—from handwritten notes to discharge letters to lab reports 
• Developing intelligent document extraction and structuring with ICD-10/SNOMED CT coding 
• Creating AI assistants that help draft all sorts of medical documentation, patient education material, and insurance and compliance forms 
• Designing for real-world healthcare: multilingual processing (24+ languages), GDPR/MDR compliance built in 
• Working on challenging NLP problems specific to European medical language patterns

You'll work directly with our CTO Nikita Tarasov on core infrastructure decisions and implement the latest ML technologies in a compliant manner. No competing projects—just one product, built right.

Our team: 5 core members from different countries, speaking 9 languages collectively. I'm a doctor-turned-founder, bringing healthcare expertise to technical decisions. We reason from first principles, move fast, remove roadblocks efficiently, and build solid foundations—no shortcuts on quality.

Requirements: 
• Work authorization in Germany 
• Drive to transform healthcare through technology
• German language skills valuable (other European languages also great) 

We prefer warm introductions—no recruiters please. Join us in giving healthcare professionals their time back and enabling them to do what made them choose this profession in the first place: being there for their patients.

#MachineLearning #HealthTech #MLJobs #GermanyJobs #AIEngineering

Wie kann Künstliche Intelligenz die gemeinsame Entscheidungsfindung zwischen Ärzt:innen und Patient:innen unterstützen?  

Anlässlich des bundesweiten Digitaltages 2025 stellt ein Teil des 12-köpfigen Autorenteams das White Paper “Mit KI zur gemeinsamen ­Entscheidungsfindung in der Medizin” vor. Der praktische Wegweiser zeigt an Beispielen, wie Künstliche Intelligenz ein “Shared Decision Making” zwischen Ärzt:innen und Patient:innen unterstützen kann.

💡Lead Autor und Arzt Dr. Sven Jungmann, Patientin Nele von Horsten und Anja Thelen von Roche als Projektleitung zeigen an Beispielen die Nutzung des Wegweisers. Die Moderation übernimmt Dr. Cornelius Wittal. Eine rege Diskussion ist erwünscht. Die Veranstaltung richtet sich an Patient:innen, Angehörige und Ärzt:innen. 

🗓️Veranstaltungstag: 26.06.2025, von 12:00 Uhr bis 12:45 Uhr. Virtuelle Veranstaltung.

👉Zur Registrierung bitte via Online-Formular unter https://lnkd.in/e4XFA6Zp (Website cvent.com). Eine Bestätigung wird per E-Mail versandt (Absender der Bestätigungs-E-Mail ist grenzach.events at roche.com).

Die Übertragung findet virtuell mit ZOOM statt. Nur die Referent:innen und der Moderator werden mit einem Videobild übertragen. Fragen werden per Chatfunktion (F/A) mit dem Webconferencing-Tool Zoom gestellt.

🏥 ML Engineer Opportunity: Build AI Infrastructure for European Healthcare 🏥

We're looking for an ML Engineer based in Germany to join our international team at aiomics. If you know someone great—or if this sounds like you—please reach out directly. 🙋♂️ 

What we're building: We're currently implementing our AI platform across 7 hospital facilities with advanced medical services. Our product is designed to save medical teams hours daily on documentation, using that time for meaningful patient care instead while having much better information on their patients. Our early hospital partners alone could reach 5M patients annually—and we are only getting started. There have several more implementations in preparation right now.

What we're working on: 
• Building ML systems that process unstructured medical data in various languages—from handwritten notes to discharge letters to lab reports 
• Developing intelligent document extraction and structuring with ICD-10/SNOMED CT coding 
• Creating AI assistants that help draft all sorts of medical documentation, patient education material, and insurance and compliance forms 
• Designing for real-world healthcare: multilingual processing (24+ languages), GDPR/MDR compliance built in 
• Working on challenging NLP problems specific to European medical language patterns

You'll work directly with our CTO Nikita Tarasov on core infrastructure decisions and implement the latest ML technologies in a compliant manner. No competing projects—just one product, built right.

Our team: 5 core members from different countries, speaking 9 languages collectively. I'm a doctor-turned-founder, bringing healthcare expertise to technical decisions. We reason from first principles, move fast, remove roadblocks efficiently, and build solid foundations—no shortcuts on quality.

Requirements: 
• Work authorization in Germany 
• Drive to transform healthcare through technology
• German language skills valuable (other European languages also great) 

We prefer warm introductions—no recruiters please. Join us in giving healthcare professionals their time back and enabling them to do what made them choose this profession in the first place: being there for their patients.

#MachineLearning #HealthTech #MLJobs #GermanyJobs #AIEngineering

Two startup reality checks from our journey:
First: Everyone talks about building solutions with end users, but in healthcare, getting genuine access to clinical teams who can dedicate time to co-creation is incredibly challenging.

Second: German hospitals have a reputation for being slow to adopt new technologies. Just a few months ago, we couldn't have imagined we'd be spending most of our time building directly with hospital teams.

But something has shifted. Healthcare organizations are now actively seeking innovation partners, and MEDICLIN under Dr. Christian Dohmen-Griesenbach's leadership is pioneering this change.

What makes this partnership remarkable is the depth of collaboration. Linda Pistor, Dr. Dimitrios Artemis, Prof. Dr. Philipp Hüllemann, Dr. Max Holger Warnke, Dr. Florian Weber, and their colleagues aren't just stakeholders providing occasional feedback. They're opening up their workflows, sharing their daily  challenges with documentation, and actively shaping how our infrastructure evolves.

We're learning from the field what rehabilitation physicians need during admissions, how nurses navigate between systems, what information therapists actually need for treatment planning, and what legally mandated compliance tasks are keeping staff away from meaningful patient interactions. This isn't theoretical user research – it's building alongside the people who know exactly where technology can make the biggest difference.

The readiness for change we're witnessing at MEDICLIN signals something bigger: German healthcare is ready to pick up significant pace in digital transformation.

More insights from this collaboration coming soon.

#StartupLessons #HealthTech #GermanHealthcare #DigitalTransformation
updates.reshared_post_author_headline: Leiter KI und Digitale Transformation bei der MEDICLIN Management GmbH & Co. KG | Ideentreiber für die Zukunft des Gesundheitswesens
updates.reshared_post_description:
💡 Pfingsten, Heiliger Geist und die digitale Erleuchtung im Gesundheitswesen

Pfingsten steht traditionell für Inspiration, Aufbruch – und den „Heiligen Geist“ als Impulsgeber für Verständigung und Veränderung. Ein passender Anlass, um über strukturelle Erneuerung im Gesundheitswesen nachzudenken.

🧠 Der aktuelle Interview-Beitrag mit dem Arzt und KI-Experten Dr. Sven Jungmann im FOCUS zur Rolle von KI in der Medizin bringt zentrale Gedanken auf den Punkt:

• KI ist kein Ersatz, sondern ein Werkzeug, um ärztliches Denken zu erweitern.
• Der Einstieg gelingt über pragmatische Automatisierungen – etwa in der Dokumentation und Prozessstruktur.
• Die Grundlage bleibt: saubere, vielfältige und vernetzte Daten.

https://lnkd.in/ehksfPtC

🛠️ Genau hier setzen wir auch bei #MEDICLIN gemeinsam mit Sven in einem zentralen Projekt an. Dort befassen wir uns mit der automatisierten Strukturierung großer Mengen klinischer Informationen – aus Vorsystemen, von Papier und aus unstrukturierten Formaten. Ziel ist es, diese Daten für eine intelligente Weiterverarbeitung verfügbar zu machen: schneller, nachvollziehbarer, nutzbar für Patientenversorgung und Entscheidungsunterstützung und Entlastung. Und natürlich folgt dieses Projekt einer Gesamtstrategie.

🤝 Besonders wichtig:
Dieses Projekt entsteht nicht top-down, sondern wird aus der klinischen Praxis heraus gestaltet – gemeinsam mit Ärzten, Therapeuten, Pflegekräften, Qualitätsmanagern und Kaufleuten. Die digitale Transformation wird dadurch konkreter, anschlussfähiger und nachhaltiger. Deshalb ein großer Dank an Linda Pistor, Dr. Dimitrios Artemis, Prof. Dr. Philipp Hüllemann, Dr. Max Holger Warnke, Dr. Florian Weber u.v.m. über den Blick hinter die Kulissen der Reha von heute. Wer sich noch am Projekt beteiligen möchte, kann sich gerne bei mir melden!

🌬️ Pfingsten als Fest der Verständigung erinnert uns daran, dass Fortschritt dort gelingt, wo wir Komplexität in Struktur überführen – mit digitalen Mitteln, aber im Dienst eines menschlichen Gesundheitswesens.

#DigitaleGesundheit #KIinderReha #BottomUpInnovation #Pfingsten2025

Milestone Achievement: Aiomics® Recognized by BAFA INVEST Zuschuss Program
We're pleased to share that we have been approved for the BAFA INVEST Zuschuss program by the German Federal Office for Economic Affairs and Export Control (BAFA). This recognition formally classifies us as a "young innovative company" within the German startup ecosystem.

What is the BAFA INVEST Zuschuss?
For those unfamiliar with this program, it represents a strategic initiative by the German government to stimulate investment in innovative early-stage companies. The program functions as a de facto government endorsement of a startup's innovation potential and business model viability.

The Significance Beyond Financial Benefits
This approval process involves an independent evaluation of our company conducted by federal authorities.

This designation carries three key implications:

1. External Validation: It provides independent verification of our innovation claims and business model from government experts who evaluate hundreds of companies annually.
2. Risk Mitigation for Investors: The program offers private investors a 15% reimbursement on their investment and a 25% reimbursement on their exit sum, effectively improving the risk-return profile of investing in our company.
3. Ecosystem Recognition: It positions us within Germany's formal innovation framework, potentially opening doors to additional innovation-focused resources, partnerships, and networks.

We see this milestone not merely as a financial incentive mechanism, but as validation of our team's hard work and our strategic direction. And we're pleased to be able to sweeten the deal for our ever so supportive investors, many of which have been an integral part of Dr. Sven Jungmann's previous journey(s). 

We're grateful for this recognition and look forward to delivering on the innovative potential that this designation acknowledges.

#Innovation #StartupGrowth #GermanTech #BAFA #aiomics

In drei Wochen ist es endlich so weit Dr. Tina Wenz Philipp Koch Dr. Sven Jungmann Jeremy Dähn Charlene Nowotny Nico Vogler Daniel Dominik Hecht Seroton Minddistrict DACH POLYPOINT Deutschland GmbH Healex DMI GmbH & Co. KG u.v.a.m. 🚀🚀🤖🤖😎😎 Freu mich drauf! Schon jetzt ein Spoiler: Wir werden definitiv mehr an den Potenzialen arbeiten als an Risiken, denn Bremser und Bedenkenträger gibt‘s hierzulande schon zu genüge 😉
